Package algorithms

Class KSelect

java.lang.Object
algorithms.KSelect
public class KSelect extends Object
class with methods to find the k largest or smallest values in an array. The runtime complexities are O(N*log(k)) where N is the length of the array and the space complexities are O(k).
To make a simple parallel version for very datasets larger than Integer.MAX_VALUE, one could partition the data in j arrays. solve for top k from each j, then solve for the top k among the j result arrays. The total runtime complexity for the simple parallel version would be O((N + j) * log)k)). If have access to all j arrays at the same time and can write to same heap (no large communication costs), one can use a single heap and the same approach to result in runtime complexity O(N*log(k)).

    • topK

      public static double[] topK(double[] a, int k)
      find the top k elements of k, that is, the k largest values in a. The runtime complexity is O(n * log(k)) where n is a.length and the space cmplexity is O(k).
      Parameters:
      a -
      k -
      Returns:
      the k largest elements of k in descending order.
